### Exercise: French Living Room Nouns and Gender

Practice the gender of French living room nouns and their articles.

#### 1. Assign the correct definite article (*le/la/l'*) to each item:

\_\_\_ canapé (sofa) 🛋️ → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le')">

\_\_\_ lampe (lamp) 💡 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la')">

\_\_\_ horloge (clock) 🕰️ → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'l\'')">

\_\_\_ fauteuil (armchair) 🪑 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le')">

\_\_\_ table basse (coffee table) 🛋️ → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la')">

\_\_\_ rideaux (curtains) 🪟 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'/les" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'les')">[(plural!)]{style="margin-left:10px;"}

\_\_\_ télévision (television) 📺 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la')">

\_\_\_ tapis (rug) 🏠 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le')">

#### 2. Match the French term to its English equivalent:

**"le coussin"** 🛋️ → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'cushion')">

**"la bibliothèque"** 📚 → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'bookcase')">

**"le tableau"** 🖼️ → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'painting')">

**"les étagères"** 📚 → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'shelves')">

#### 3. Fill in the blanks with the correct term:

"\_\_\_ (The sofa) est confortable." 🛋️ → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le canapé')">

"J’allume \_\_\_ (the lamp)." 💡 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la lampe')">

"Nous avons \_\_\_ (curtains) rouges." 🪟 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'des rideaux')">

"Il regarde \_\_\_ (the television)." 📺 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la télévision')">

"Elle pose le livre sur \_\_\_ (the coffee table)." 🛋️ → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la table basse')">

"Je nettoie \_\_\_ (the rug)." 🏠 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le tapis')">

"Nous décorons \_\_\_ (the shelves)." 📚 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'les étagères')">

#### 4. Correct the errors in gender/number:

"Un lampe" 💡 → <input type="text" placeholder="Correct phrase" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'une lampe')">

"La canapé" 🛋️ → <input type="text" placeholder="Correct phrase" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le canapé')">

"Des coussin" 🛋️ → <input type="text" placeholder="Correct phrase" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'des coussins')">

```{=html}
<script>
function checkAnswer(input, correctAnswer) {
  const span = input.nextElementSibling;
  if (input.value.trim().toLowerCase() === correctAnswer.toLowerCase()) {
    span.textContent = "✓ Correct";
    span.style.color = "green";
  } else {
    span.textContent = "";
  }
}

function showAnswers() {
  document.querySelectorAll('input[type="text"]').forEach(el => {
    const correct = el.getAttribute('oninput')?.match(/'([^']+)'/)?.[1];
    if (correct) {
      const span = el.nextElementSibling;
      span.textContent = `Réponse : ${correct}`;
      span.style.color = "blue";
    }
  });
}

function refreshPage() {
  location.reload();
}
</script>
```

#### 5. Translate into French (include articles!):

"We sit on the sofa and watch television."\

```{=html}
<textarea placeholder="Nous..." rows="2" cols="50" oninput="checkTranslation(this, 'Nous nous asseyons sur le canapé et regardons la télévision')"></textarea>
```

"The lamp is on the coffee table."\

```{=html}
<textarea placeholder="La lampe..." rows="2" cols="50" oninput="checkTranslation(this, 'La lampe est sur la table basse')"></textarea>
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Notes:

-   **Gender hints**: Most items ending in *-e* are feminine (*la lampe*), but exceptions exist (*le canapé*).\
-   **Plural alert**: *Rideaux* (curtains) and *étagères* (shelves) are always plural. Other examples include *les coussins* (cushions) and *les tableaux* (paintings).
:::

### Notes :

-   **Astuces de genre** : La plupart des mots finissant par *-e* sont féminins (*la lampe*), mais il y a des exceptions (*le canapé*).\
